title: How to Uninstall Programs in Linux Mint

steps.title: Click Menu.
steps.content: Click Menu. Go to the applications you want to remove. Right click on the unwanted software and select Uninstall.

steps.title: Type your password and press Authenticate when asked.
steps.content: Type your password and press Authenticate when asked.

steps.title: Look for the message that says, "the following packages will be removed."
steps.content: Look for the message that says, "the following packages will be removed." Click Remove.

steps.title: Wait for the programs to be removed.
steps.content: Wait for the programs to be removed. This can take some time. When the window disappears is the uninstalling ready and the software is removed.

steps.title: Open the Synaptic Package Manager.
steps.content: Open the Synaptic Package Manager. Click Menu and Package Manager; it will ask for your password.

steps.title: Type the name of software you want to uninstall in the Quick filter.
steps.content: Type the name of software you want to uninstall in the Quick filter.

steps.title: Right-click on the package you want to uninstall and select “Mark for Removal”.
steps.content: Right-click on the package you want to uninstall and select “Mark for Removal”.

steps.title: Click Apply, to apply all marked changes.
steps.content: Click Apply, to apply all marked changes.

steps.title: Check out the summary.
steps.content: Check out the summary. This is the last opportunity to look trough the list of marked changes before they are applied. Click Apply.

steps.title: Wait for the software to be removed.
steps.content: Wait for the software to be removed. The marked changes are now being applied.

steps.title: Open Terminal with keyboard short-cut CTRL+ALT+T.
steps.content: Open Terminal with keyboard short-cut CTRL+ALT+T.

steps.title: Copy the following command:
steps.content: Copy the following command: sudo apt-get remove frozen-bubble

steps.title: Look at the Terminal window for lots of information!
steps.content: Look at the Terminal window for lots of information! Example: The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required.

steps.title: Use ‘apt-get autoremove’ to remove them.
steps.content: Use ‘apt-get autoremove’ to remove them. The command “autoremove” is the most effective. To continue type Y and hit Enter.
